Leans against the door breathing heavily after running away, indicating emotional overwhelm and lack of control.
Sits drinking beer observing others with some attention, potentially showing awareness and reflection.
Fumbles in his pocket for money, leaves a dollar on the table, and rushes out to follow Elaine.
Politely and cheerfully waits and tries to get past people to talk to Elaine, showing persistence but in a gentle manner.
Leans in a little and asks Elaine where she is headed, showing sincere interest.
Repeatedly asks Elaine where she is meeting, despite her minimal responses, indicating attentive concern.
Offers to ride out to the zoo with Elaine despite not having been there before.
Walks a step behind Elaine, nervously looks around, seems unsure.
Admits he is not enrolled but tries to engage in classes and talks about having a pleasant room.
Suggests getting together later to talk things over with Elaine.
Volunteers to ride out to the Zoo with Elaine despite not knowing the place well.
Walks a step behind Elaine, nervously darting glances to the right and left.
Asks Elaine questions to help locate the person she is meeting, but appears uncertain and unsure.
Explains he is sitting in on classes without being enrolled, showing some initiative but also a lack of formal commitment.
Attempts to deflect Elaine's frustration with vague responses and tries to suggest meeting later to talk, avoiding confronting the issue directly.
Greets Carl Smith warmly and shakes his hand.
Watches Carl and Elaine walk away with a forced smile that quickly disappears, shows visible agony and distance.
Greets Carl confidently with a firm handshake and friendly words.
Turns away from Carl and Elaine abruptly and walks off, showing discomfort but manages to steady himself.
Shows internal emotional struggle and pain visibly, losing his artificial smile and appearing shaken.
Carefully tidies the room by straightening the newspaper, even using an iron to do so, showing consideration for his environment.
Invites Elaine to come in and engage in conversation when she knocks.
Responds honestly and directly to Elaine's questions about why he is in Berkeley.
Expresses his love to Elaine openly despite her telling him to leave.
Moves in behind Elaine, puts his hand on her arm, touches her hair, gently pushes her onto the bed, kneels beside her, places hand on her shoulder, and talks calmly to understand her concerns.
Insists repeatedly on hearing Elaine’s version and denies the accusation sincerely and calmly.
Ignores Elaine’s requests to be let go immediately, restraining her physically.
Attempts to calmly question Elaine about the accusation, seeking to clarify the situation.
Physically restrains Elaine by touching her arm, pushing her down on the bed, and putting his hands on her shoulder despite her requests to be let go.
Denies the accusation firmly but struggles to convincingly convey his side of the story.
Persists in speaking and tries to explain events from his perspective, showing some presence of mind under high emotional stress.
Leaps off the bed and brings Elaine water after she screams, tries to calm the situation, reassures others she is ok.
Edges through the door to control the situation, physically puts himself between Elaine and others.
Responds to ominous situation with Mr. McCleery and boys by trying to downplay and avoid escalation.
Calms the boys down, assuring no need for police intervention.
Politely questions Mr. McCleery about why he is asked to leave.
Apologizes to Elaine but remains distant and reserved when packing.
Allows Elaine to sit quietly while he packs without pushing her away.
Shares a personal item (marble from grandmother) to Elaine while packing.
Responds curtly and somewhat irritably when Elaine asks about his plans, telling her to stop asking.
Continues packing quietly without engaging further with Elaine's emotional pleas.
Packs belongings in a distracted and indecisive manner, struggles to answer direct questions about his plans and destination.
Shows some sentimental value and awareness by packing a marble from his grandmother along with his belongings.
Responds irritably when pressured about his future plans, indicating discomfort and lack of clarity.
Initiates a kiss and immediately proposes marriage to Elaine with little apparent thought or preparation.
Attempts to assert certainty and make decisions about marriage despite Elaine's clear confusion and hesitation.
Engages Elaine directly about her feelings and intentions, trying to elicit clarity.
Attempts to make practical plans with Elaine (suggesting blood tests and preparing documents) despite her hesitation.
Pushes through students to keep pace with Elaine, showing eagerness and engagement.
Continues conversation and questions Elaine about why she doubts their relationship, showing interest in her feelings.
Left standing alone in the hallway after Elaine abruptly retreats, showing a sense of isolation but no visible frustration or anger.
Receives a threatening telegram and crumples it in his hand, showing some emotional response but no clear decisive action.
Suggests going to get blood tests promptly and plans practical steps for marriage documentation, showing some initiative and planning.
Pushes through a crowd of students to keep pace with Elaine, showing determination and physical assertiveness to maintain contact.
Is left alone in the corridor after Elaine leaves for class, appears to wait passively by leaning against the wall without taking further action.
Follows Elaine attentively, tries to discuss plans for blood tests and marriage, shows engagement in the conversation.
Repeatedly asks for clarification about Carl and Elaine's intentions.
Fails to grasp Elaine's possible relationship with Carl fully, reacts with surprise and confusion.
Smiles expectantly and breaks up when a man passes by after Elaine kisses him.
Purchases a ring, pays for it, and whistles happily.
Carries flowers and boxes into his room, appearing cheerful.
Asks repeatedly about where something happened, presses Elaine as she tries to move away.
Tries to explain himself calmly and insists he has no personal feelings or resentment toward Mr. Robinson despite the tension.
Openly admits he does not respect Mr. Robinson.
Attempts to de-escalate conflict by denying any threat and asking to avoid hostility.
Attempts to explain himself calmly and deny personal resentment, tries to de-escalate conflict by stating lack of personal feelings against Mr. Robinson.
Takes a step forward toward Mr. Robinson during a tense confrontation, potentially escalating the situation.
Fails to grasp or address the deeper implications of Mr. Robinson's statements regarding the divorce and consequences of his actions.
Tells Mr. Robinson he loves his daughter sincerely and tries to clarify the nature of his relationship with Mrs. Robinson.
Raises his voice in anger or frustration during the confrontation.
Attempts to calmly explain to Mr. Robinson that his relationship with Mrs. Robinson meant nothing and insists he loves Elaine, showing some clarity and composure.
Takes a step toward Mr. Robinson after he threatens him, potentially escalating the confrontation.
Offers money to Mr. McCleery to use the phone, attempts polite request despite refusal.
Runs out after Mr. Robinson's insults without responding aggressively, shows restraint.
Attempts to negotiate by offering money for phone use but abandons the bribe when refused, then runs away.
Attempts to negotiate with Mr. McCleery to use the pay phone and offers money multiple times showing some quick thinking and persistence.
Fails to successfully make a call or resolve the situation with Mr. McCleery and has to run away after being threatened with police involvement.
Decides to run after failing to convince Mr. McCleery, showing a lack of better strategic options or control of the situation.
Reads Elaine's heartfelt letter and respects her decision despite his hurt.
Sneaks into the Robinson house at night and disturbs Elaine by throwing a pebble at her window.
Removes shoes and quietly enters the house, indicating consideration to not make noise.
Reads Elaine's note calmly while driving, processing emotional information without panic.
Climbs fence, removes shoes quietly, tries back door and enters the Robinson house stealthily at night.
Attempts to get Elaine's attention by softly shouting and throwing a pebble at her window.
Breaks into Elaine's home at night uninvited, showing disregard for boundaries and social norms.
Goes into Elaine's room looking for her and follows Mrs. Robinson when she moves past him, demanding to know where Elaine is.
Demands to see Elaine despite Mrs. Robinson's attempts to stop him.
Goes into Elaine's room and follows Mrs. Robinson into her room to find Elaine, showing initiative and determination.
Does not question Mrs. Robinson’s seemingly suspicious or manipulative behavior; passively allows her to control the situation.
Directly confronts Mrs. Robinson about Elaine’s whereabouts, showing some assertiveness.
Seems confused and reactive rather than proactive, failing to take control or prevent Mrs. Robinson from calling the police and framing him as a 'burglar'.
Runs after Mrs. Robinson to stop the wedding, tries to find Elaine.
Drives rapidly, ignoring other cars, visibly frustrated and yelling about the wedding.
Politely asks fraternity brothers about Carl Smith's whereabouts despite their rude and mocking responses.
Attempts to gather useful information by asking multiple fraternity brothers about Carl Smith's whereabouts and the wedding location.
Accepts vague or unhelpful answers politely but does not press further or clarify unclear information.
Politely smiles at the fraternity brothers' banter.
Engages minimally in conversation, does not contribute to the joking or laughter.
Takes the initiative to go to the Make Out King's wedding, indicating social commitment.
Asks questions to gather information about the wedding location despite only getting vague answers.
Shows polite social behavior by giving a polite smile to the fraternity brothers despite their mocking laughter.
Drives to Santa Barbara alone while looking exhausted but persists in the task of reaching the destination.
Appears uncertain or lacks specific knowledge about his destination (wedding location), indicating lack of preparation or information.
Runs into the gas station office and immediately begins looking for ways to get a phone to call, showing initiative and problem-solving.
Calls a stranger's answering service and impersonates a relative to get information needed for a wedding ceremony.
Uses a phone directory to find a relevant contact, calls the doctor's answering service, and conveys a plausible story to obtain needed information.
Appears somewhat uncertain and relies on incomplete information (forgot what church), requiring assistance from others to proceed.
Corrects the attendant politely ('I'm not a priest - I'm a minister.')
Leaves car door open when jumping out to run
Runs urgently to church to presumably participate or intervene in wedding
Attempts to correct the attendant by clarifying he is a minister, not a priest.
Fails to notice the car running out of gas until the engine fails and comes to a stop by the curb.
After car breaks down, quickly assesses situation and runs purposefully toward the church.
Shows determination and resourcefulness by running around the church to find an open entrance when front doors are locked.
Frantically tries to stop Elaine's wedding by pounding on the church window and shouting her name, showing desperation and emotional openness.
Rushes to the church balcony during the wedding and pounds on the glass, shouting to stop the ceremony.
Expresses desperation and frustration vocally and physically but fails to intervene effectively before the wedding is finalized.
Hits Mr. Robinson in the face to defend himself during a confrontation.
Grabs Elaine's hand and pulls her toward the doors, urging her not to faint.
Breaks Carl's hold, picks up a nearby gold cross, and uses it as a weapon to intimidate Carl and clear the way.
Starts to go back down the stairs after yelling for Elaine, showing possible hesitation or loss of momentum.
Raises the cross to threaten and clear a path, allowing Elaine to escape.
Grabs Elaine's wrist and urges her to run, helps her up after she falls.
Holds Elaine's hand and pulls her toward the bus, bangs on the bus door to get it to open.
Offers money to the bus driver and sits beside Elaine, ensuring her comfort.
Raises the cross to intimidate the man blocking the door, successfully clearing a path.
Jams the cross through the church door handles to prevent it from closing, allowing Elaine and himself to escape.
Quickly helps Elaine up after she falls while running, showing presence of mind and concern.
Bangs on the bus door to get it to open just as the doors are closing, enabling their escape.
Negotiates with the bus driver and directs him to drive to the end of the line, facilitating their getaway.
Leads Elaine to sit in a seat on the bus and stays close, showing protective and decisive behavior.
Allows Elaine to take his hand during a tense moment on the bus.
Encourages the bus driver to start moving the bus to escape the situation.
Commands the bus driver to start moving, taking initiative to escape the situation.
